name: Lacanian Real/Imaginary Analysis
intent: Applies Lacanian psychoanalytic theory to detect gaps between stated security policies (Symbolic) and actual threats (Real), with Imaginary mediating organizational self-perception. Identifies where security narratives diverge from reality.
implementation_readiness: MEDIUM - Theory defined, awaits Neo4j schema integration

name: Vendor Equipment Tracking
intent: Comprehensive vendor and equipment asset management integrated with cybersecurity threat intelligence. Tracks vendor relationships, equipment inventory, and associated vulnerabilities.
implementation_readiness: HIGH - Clear requirements, standard database design

name: Protocol Analysis
intent: Deep analysis of communication protocols (ICS/OT, network, application-layer) to identify protocol-specific vulnerabilities and attack vectors. Focuses on industrial control system protocols.
implementation_readiness: MEDIUM - Requires protocol expertise and ICS testbed

name: Lacanian Dyad Analysis
intent: Models adversarial relationships between defenders and attackers using Lacanian psychoanalytic dyad theory. Predicts escalation dynamics and behavioral patterns in cyber conflicts.
implementation_readiness: MEDIUM - Mathematical framework defined, requires validation

name: Triad Group Dynamics
intent: Analyzes organizational stability using Lacanian three-register Borromean knot topology. Models team dynamics and detects when organizations approach crisis (Seldon Crisis detection).
technical_complexity: VERY HIGH - Topology and psychometric integration
implementation_readiness: MEDIUM - Mathematical models complete, requires organizational data

name: Organizational Blind Spots
intent: Detects security blind spots—threats invisible to the organization due to cognitive biases, structural gaps, or cultural factors. Maps perception gradients to identify zero-visibility threat regions.
implementation_readiness: HIGH - Algorithm defined, awaits organizational data integration

name: Personality-Team Fit
intent: Optimizes security team composition using psychometric distance calculations. Predicts person-team fit scores, conflict probability, and performance impact for hiring and team rebalancing decisions.
implementation_readiness: HIGH - Mathematical framework complete, requires HR data integration

name: Transcript Psychometric NER
intent: Extracts psychometric profiles (Big Five, Dark Triad, Lacanian registers) from interview transcripts using NER11 Gold model. Converts qualitative interview data into quantitative personality vectors.
technical_complexity: VERY HIGH - NLP + psychometric feature extraction
key_deliverables: Big Five and Dark Triad scoring from text
implementation_readiness: MEDIUM - Requires NER11 model extension and linguistic marker library

name: Seldon Crisis Prediction
intent: Implements Asimov-inspired psychohistory for cybersecurity: predicts organizational crises using mathematical models (bifurcation, critical slowing, Ising dynamics). Provides early warning signals for system-wide failures.
implementation_readiness: MEDIUM - Mathematical models validated, requires historical data calibration

name: Population Event Forecasting
intent: Applies psychohistory principle: individual behavior is unpredictable, but large populations follow statistical laws. Forecasts cybersecurity events at demographic, sectoral, and geographic scales using population-level vulnerability modeling.
technical_complexity: VERY HIGH - Demographic modeling + threat intelligence integration
key_deliverables: Sector-specific forecasting models (healthcare, financial, critical infrastructure)
GDELT news + social media sentiment integration
implementation_readiness: LOW - Requires large-scale demographic data and extensive validation

name: Cognitive Dissonance Breaking
intent: Lacanian-inspired system to detect and resolve cognitive dissonance in cybersecurity decision-making. Identifies gaps between stated security beliefs (Symbolic) and actual behaviors (Real), then deploys targeted interventions to align behavior with reality.
key_deliverables: Personalized intervention design (confrontation, reframing, incremental change, social proof, authority)
implementation_readiness: MEDIUM - Framework complete, requires organizational behavioral data

name: Threat Actor Personality Modeling
intent: Multi-hop graph traversal (up to 20 hops) to infer threat actor personalities from observable behaviors (TTPs, infrastructure, targets). Applies Big Five, Dark Triad, Enneagram, and MBTI frameworks to predict adversary behavior and inform defensive strategies.
technical_complexity: VERY HIGH - Multi-hop reasoning + psychometric inference
key_deliverables: Threat actor personality profiles (APT28, Lazarus, FIN7, etc.)
implementation_readiness: MEDIUM - Query patterns defined, requires threat intelligence data integration

name: McKenney-Lacan Psychometrics Calculus
intent: Revolutionary mathematical framework merging Lacanian psychoanalytic theory with McKenney psychohistory. Provides rigorous formulations for dyad analysis (Λ), triad stability (Τ), group dynamics (Σ), blind spots (B), cognitive dissonance (D), crisis prediction (P), and team fit (F).
implementation_readiness: HIGH - Framework documented, APIs designed, awaits implementation

name: Entity Expansion + Psychohistory
intent: Expands Neo4j schema from 8 to 32 entity labels to support full NER11 Gold Standard (197 entities → 16 Super Labels). Integrates mathematical psychohistory equations (Epidemic, Ising, Granovetter, Bifurcation, Critical Slowing) for Seldon Crisis detection.
technical_complexity: VERY HIGH - Schema migration + mathematical modeling

name: NER11 Gold Hierarchical Integration
intent: Large-scale document ingestion using NER11 Gold model with hierarchical entity extraction. Processes 944 documents from EAB, McKenney-Lacan, AEON Training Data, Threat Research, and Organizations to create comprehensive knowledge graph.
technical_complexity: HIGH - Large-scale ETL + API rate limiting
